employment.description: Object containing the financial data relating to a single employment.

pay.description: Object containing pay details for a single employment.

deductions.description: Object containing details of deductions or a single employment.

benefitsInKind.description: Object containing amount values of benefits received from a single employment.

taxablePayToDate.description: The gross pay for this employment. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

totalTaxToDate.description: The amount of tax deducted for this employment. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

tipsAndOtherPayments.description: The total amount of any tips and gratuities not paid by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

studentLoans.description: Object containing details of deductions against student loans.

uglDeductionAmount.description: The amount deducted for an undergraduate student loan. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

pglDeductionAmount.description: The amount deducted for a postgraduate student loan. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

accommodation.description: The value of accommodation costs provided by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

assets.description: The value of any goods provided by the employer not exclusively used for work. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

assetsTransfer.description: The value of any company assets signed over by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

beneficialLoan.description: The amount of interest free or low interest loans given by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

car.description: The cash equivalent of any cars made available by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

carFuel.description: The amount paid for fuel when using company cars. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

educationalServices.description: Scholarships or school fees paid by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

entertaining.description: Entertainment costs paid by the employer either directly or reimbursed to the employee. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

expenses.description: Expenses reimbursed by the employer to the employee. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

medicalInsurance.description: The sum of insurance premiums paid by the employer for medical or dental insurance. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

telephone.description: Telephone costs paid by the employer that are not exempt. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

service.description: Services used by an employee and paid for by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

taxableExpenses.description: Taxable expenses reimbursed by the employer to the employee. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

van.description: The cash equivalent of any vans made available by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

vanFuel.description: The amount paid by the employer for fuel costs when using company vans. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

mileage.description: The mileage amount paid over HMRC's approved rate by the employer for use of employees' own car for work. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

nonQualifyingRelocationExpenses.description: Other costs involved in relocation paid for directly by the employer or reimbursed to the employee. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

nurseryPlaces.description: Childcare costs paid by the employer or voucher or commercial childcare costs above the exempt limit. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

otherItems.description: The value of any other benefits. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

paymentsOnEmployeesBehalf.description: Other costs incurred by the employee paid for by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

personalIncidentalExpenses.description: Incidental (non-business) expenses incurred by an employee while travelling on business. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

qualifyingRelocationExpenses.description: Employer paid costs associated with employee relocation including bridging loans. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

employerProvidedProfessionalSubscription.description: Professional fees and subscriptions paid for by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

employerProvidedServices.description: The value of services provided by the employer. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

incomeTaxPaidByDirector.description: Non PAYE Income Tax for directors deducted from the employer by HMRC. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

travelAndSubsistence.description: The cost of any travel and subsistence (accommodation, meals and so on) paid for by the employer, that is not exempt. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

vouchersAndCreditCards.description: The value of vouchers given by the employer and the expenditure of any employer provided credit cards. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

nonCash.description: The value of any other non-cash benefits paid to the employee. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

items.description: A list of endpoint links that indicate possible actions related to the current resource.

href.description: The relative URL of the endpoint.

rel.description: A label for the endpoint, which describes how it is related to the current resource. The ‘rel’ will be ‘self’ where the action is retrieval of the same resource.

method.description: The HTTP method type for the endpoint.
